entry.title: Re: Referencing New Entity in Batch Request
entry.content:
Hello @Kaito2 

Thank you for your question

In a batch changeset, the Content-ID alias ($1) cannot be used with a path segment like $1/SAP__self.PostToAccounting — this is why you saw “Content ID '$1' is not valid”.

The supported solution is to call the unbound action PostToAccounting and pass the new Billing Document reference in the request body, for example:

POST BillingDocument/PostToAccounting

{ "BillingDocument": "$1" }

Both requests remain within the same changeset; therefore, if posting to accounting fails, the billing document will not be generated.

Let me know if it works

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Change Mail Attachment Name for Billing Document
entry.content: There is a BAdI APOC_SET_OUTPUT_DOCUMENT_NAME to set the name of the rendered documents (forms) during output. It overwrites the document name that is provided by the SAP business application.

entry.title: Switching Cloud Identity tenant in Subaccount Trust Configuration
entry.content:
With OIDC Trusts in a Subaccount to Cloud Identity Services it's possible to switch the Cloud Identity tenant. You can simply edit the config and switch the tenant. User IDs and Authorizations remain untouched - everything works fine.

In the "old" Cloud Identity Tenant it even removes the Application and moves it to the "new" tenant.

Has anyone else used this in a production environment? Is this an official feature that's supported by SAP?

Regards

BTW here is how you can switch a Cloud Identity trust from SAML to OIDC:
Migrate from SAML Trust Configuration to OpenID Connect Trust with SAP Cloud Identity Services | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: Customer & Partner Roundtable for SAP BTP ABAP Environment #27

If you want to show a demo or share a use case scenario for SAP BTP ABAP Environment, send us an email and we will get back to you.
 

Introduction

As SAP BTP ABAP environment (aka Steampunk) and ABAP Cloud became more popular inside and outside of SAP, there is a high demand for rolling out the latest product news and updates, asking questions, and showing demos.

entry.title: Re: Manage Withholding Tax Items Peru – Issue with Report...
entry.content:
Hello @LuisaFernanda0204 

Hi Luisa,

I have checked your screenshots; the behaviour you're seeing is in line with the intended design. of the Peru “Manage Withholding Tax Items” app in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition.

Understanding why this occurs

The app does not transfer the invoice to a different tax period..

The Exclude, Hold, and Include functions solely determine whether an item appears in the withholding tax report run.

When you select August as the Reporting Date, the system continues to evaluate the original posting date in July. This is why the invoice does not show up in August, but appears in July with either 202508 (matching the period of the reporting date) or 999912 (a placeholder for held items).

Key points

 Exclude → Removes the item from the reporting run completely.

Hold → Keeps the item but marks it with tax period 999912, a technical placeholder; the item is on hold and won’t be reported in the regular period.

Include → The item remains with the original posting period logic. It does not move the invoice to a new period, like August.

Limitation

  •  The app cannot change tax periods retroactively. According to Peru's legal framework, the invoice must stay in its original period based on the posting or withholding tax date.  
  • SAP's delivered functionality is designed to flag items excluded, hold, and include, but does not change their reporting periods.

Here's what you can do to make a difference.

  • If the invoice genuinely relates to a later period, the correction is usually achieved by posting a reversal or rebooking and re-issuing the withholding tax.
  • Alternatively, you can handle the exception manually in your statutory return, since the system will not “move” it from July to August.

References

  • SAP Help – Withholding Tax Reporting for Peru
  • 3381726 - Modifying the admin user - SAP Commerce

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: How SAP Ariba Simplifies Everyday Business Buying and Supplier Management?
entry.content:
The Purchasing and sourcing landscape has undergone a dramatic transformation with the emergence of cloud based digital platforms that revolutionize how organizations manage their supplier relationships, sourcing processes, and Purchasing operations. In today's digitally connected business environment, companies are increasingly adopting sophisticated cloud solutions that streamline Purchasing workflows, enhance supplier collaboration, and provide real time visibility into spending patterns and sourcing activities. This digital revolution has created unprecedented opportunities for Purchasing professionals who invest in specialized cloud platform training .SAP Ariba training in Pune.

Maharashtra's digital commerce hub has positioned itself as a leading destination for cloud technology education and professional development, particularly in domains that combine traditional business processes with innovative digital solutions. The region's thriving ecosystem of multinational corporations, consulting firms, and technology service providers creates an ideal environment for learning advanced Purchasing platforms. Purchasing professionals who understand the strategic importance of digital transformation in sourcing and Purchasing are positioning themselves for executive roles, enhanced earning potential, and global career opportunities.

Visit Us:- https://share.google/UGvCETrQnSbv36UbB

The demand for skilled professionals in cloud based Purchasing platforms continues to accelerate as organizations recognize the transformative impact of digital Purchasing on operational efficiency, cost reduction, and supplier relationship management. Companies across industries including manufacturing, retail, healthcare, financial services, and consulting are implementing various cloud solutions to modernize their Purchasing functions, creating numerous career opportunities for trained professionals. The availability of specialized training programs has made it accessible for Purchasing professionals to acquire these cutting edge digital skills.

Understanding Cloud Based Purchasing Platforms

Cloud based Purchasing platforms represent sophisticated digital solutions that integrate all aspects of strategic sourcing, supplier management, contract management, and Purchasing operations into unified cloud environments. These various platforms handle supplier discovery, sourcing events, contract lifecycle management, supplier performance monitoring, and Purchasing analytics through intuitive web based interfaces. The complexity and advanced functionality of these platforms require specialized knowledge that combines Purchasing expertise with digital platform proficiency and cloud technology understanding.

The significance of mastering cloud Purchasing platforms extends beyond operational efficiency to strategic sourcing transformation and digital Purchasing innovation. Modern organizations rely on these platforms to make data driven sourcing decisions, optimize supplier relationships, reduce Purchasing costs, and enhance compliance with Purchasing policies. Professionals who complete SAP Ariba training in Pune gain various understanding of how cloud technology can transform traditional Purchasing practices into strategic digital capabilities that drive organizational competitiveness and Purchasing excellence.

Career Opportunities and Digital Market Demand

The job market for cloud Purchasing professionals demonstrates exceptional growth potential across diverse industry sectors. Organizations in manufacturing, technology, healthcare, financial services, retail, and consulting actively seek qualified professionals who can implement, configure, and optimize cloud based Purchasing platforms. The specialized nature of these digital skills enables professionals to work across different industries while maintaining their core Purchasing expertise and expanding their cloud technology capabilities.

Many graduates who have completed SAP Ariba training in Pune have successfully transitioned into high paying roles such as Ariba consultants, digital Purchasing specialists, sourcing analysts, supplier relationship managers, and Purchasing transformation leaders. The global adoption of cloud Purchasing solutions provides opportunities for international projects, remote consulting engagements, and exposure to diverse business environments. The combination of Purchasing knowledge and cloud platform expertise creates a unique skill set that commands premium compensation in the digital transformation market.

Training Methodology and Digital Learning Framework

Contemporary training programs employ innovative pedagogical approaches that combine theoretical knowledge with extensive hands on platform experience. These methodologies include interactive online demonstrations, real world sourcing simulations, cloud platform navigation workshops, digital case study analysis, and industry expert interactions. The curriculum is designed to progress systematically from fundamental cloud concepts to advanced platform configurations, allowing students to build digital competence gradually while mastering complex Purchasing scenarios.

The effectiveness of digital training programs is significantly enhanced through access to live cloud environments, experienced trainers with digital transformation backgrounds, and practical scenarios that reflect current market practices. Many institutes offering SAP Ariba training in Pune provide students with access to current platform versions and realistic business scenarios, ensuring that learning experiences translate directly to workplace productivity. This hands on approach helps students develop confidence and proficiency in navigating complex cloud Purchasing processes and platform optimizations.

Professional Certification and Digital Validation

Professional certifications serve as authoritative validation of cloud platform skills and digital Purchasing expertise, providing credible proof of competency to employers, clients, and industry professionals. The certification process typically involves various examinations that assess both theoretical understanding and practical platform navigation abilities. These globally recognized digital credentials significantly enhance career prospects, earning potential, and professional credibility while demonstrating commitment to digital excellence and continuous technology learning.

The investment in certification following completion of SAP Ariba training in Pune yields substantial returns through improved employment opportunities, higher salary offers, and enhanced professional recognition within the digital Purchasing community. Many organizations prefer or require certified professionals for senior digital transformation roles, cloud consulting engagements, and Purchasing technology leadership positions, making certification a strategic career investment. The certification process also ensures that professionals remain current with the latest platform features, digital best practices, and emerging trends in cloud Purchasing.

Industry Partnerships and Digital Transformation Exposure

The quality and relevance of digital training programs are significantly enhanced through strategic partnerships with technology companies, consulting firms, and digital transformation organizations. These collaborations provide students with exposure to current cloud practices, real world implementation projects, and networking opportunities with digital experts and potential employers. The connection between theoretical learning and practical application is crucial for developing competent professionals who can contribute immediately to digital Purchasing initiatives.

Students enrolled in SAP Ariba training in Pune benefit from the city's extensive technology ecosystem, including numerous cloud service providers, digital consulting organizations, and multinational corporations that actively collaborate with educational institutions. This rich digital environment provides opportunities for internships, cloud project work, guest lectures by transformation experts, and direct interaction with Purchasing technologists and digital platform specialists. The practical exposure gained through these interactions complements classroom instruction and helps students understand the real world challenges and opportunities in cloud Purchasing.

Advantages of Specialized Cloud Purchasing Training

  • Exceptional market demand with outstanding career growth opportunities in the rapidly expanding digital Purchasing sector 
  • various skill development combining traditional Purchasing expertise with cutting edge cloud platform knowledge and digital transformation capabilities 
  • High earning potential with significant salary premiums for cloud platform expertise and digital Purchasing specialization 
  • Global career mobility with cloud skills that are universally recognized and valued by multinational corporations worldwide 
  • Job security in essential digital transformation roles that drive organizational modernization and competitive advantage 
  • Opportunity to lead digital Purchasing initiatives and influence strategic sourcing decisions through advanced technology platforms 
  • Diverse career paths including cloud consulting, digital transformation, Purchasing technology, and strategic sourcing leadership positions 
  • Continuous learning environment that keeps professionals at the forefront of cloud technology innovation and digital Purchasing evolution

Disadvantages of Specialized Cloud Purchasing Training

  • Substantial financial investment required for various training, certification, and ongoing cloud platform skill development 
  • Steep learning curve requiring dedication to master both Purchasing processes and complex cloud technology platform functionalities 
  • Rapidly evolving cloud technology landscape requiring continuous education and regular skill updates to maintain competitive edge 
  • Intense competition among digital Purchasing professionals in the specialized cloud consulting and transformation job market 
  • Initial lack of hands on cloud implementation experience may impact immediate job placement opportunities and starting compensation levels 
  • Dependence on specific cloud platforms that may limit flexibility in certain market segments or organizational technology preferences 
  • Pressure to maintain current cloud certifications through regular renewals, continuing education, and professional development commitments 
  • Complex digital subject matter requiring strong analytical skills and technical aptitude for successful platform mastery

Frequently Asked Questions

What professional background is most beneficial for cloud Purchasing platform training programs? 

Candidates typically benefit from backgrounds in Purchasing, supply chain management, business administration, or related fields. However, professionals with strong analytical skills and technology aptitude can also succeed with proper foundational preparation.

How long does various training in cloud Purchasing platforms typically require? Program duration varies based on format and learning intensity. Full time programs generally range from 2 to 3 months, while part time options designed for working professionals may extend from 3 to 5 months.

What specific career roles become available after completing specialized Ariba training? Graduates can pursue positions including Ariba consultant, digital Purchasing analyst, sourcing specialist, supplier relationship manager, Purchasing technology coordinator, and cloud implementation specialist roles.

Is previous experience with cloud technologies necessary before starting Purchasing platform training? 

Prior cloud experience is helpful but not essential. Basic computer skills, understanding of Purchasing processes, and willingness to learn digital technologies are beneficial for successful program completion.

What salary expectations are realistic for professionals entering the cloud Purchasing field? 

Entry level positions typically offer compensation between 5 to 8 lakhs per annum, with substantial growth potential based on cloud expertise, certifications, industry experience, and specialization areas.

Are there opportunities for freelance consulting and independent work in cloud Purchasing platforms? 

Yes, experienced professionals often pursue consulting opportunities that provide higher earnings, diverse project experiences, and flexible work arrangements across different industries and cloud implementations.

Selecting the Optimal Training Provider

Choosing the right training provider represents a critical decision that can significantly impact career outcomes and cloud skill development. Essential factors to evaluate include trainer qualifications and cloud platform experience, curriculum various and current technology relevance, infrastructure quality and platform access, placement assistance and industry connections, and alumni success stories and ongoing professional support. The provider's reputation and track record in producing successful cloud Purchasing professionals should be carefully assessed.

When evaluating options for SAP Ariba training in Pune, prospective students should conduct thorough research including attending platform demonstrations, reviewing detailed course curricula, speaking with former students about their career progression, and assessing the provider's relationships with cloud technology companies. The quality of hands on platform training, job placement assistance, and alumni networking opportunities can significantly influence both immediate employment prospects and long term career development in cloud Purchasing.

Future Trends and Cloud Technology Evolution

The cloud Purchasing domain continues to evolve with integration of artificial intelligence, machine learning, blockchain technology, advanced analytics, and intelligent automation capabilities. These technological advancements are creating new opportunities for skilled professionals while also requiring continuous adaptation and digital skill enhancement. Understanding emerging trends and preparing for future cloud developments is essential for maintaining career relevance and competitive positioning in the dynamic digital Purchasing landscape.

Professionals who complete SAP Ariba training in Pune and stay current with cloud technology developments are better positioned to capitalize on emerging opportunities and advance their careers strategically. The ability to adapt to evolving cloud platforms while maintaining strong foundational knowledge in Purchasing principles creates sustained competitive advantage in the rapidly changing digital business environment.

Building Sustainable Digital Career Success

Long term success in the cloud Purchasing field requires more than platform technical knowledge. Professionals must develop strong strategic thinking abilities, change management skills, stakeholder collaboration capabilities, and effective digital communication abilities. The combination of technical platform expertise, Purchasing knowledge, and digital leadership skills creates well rounded professionals who can excel in diverse roles while contributing meaningfully to organizational digital transformation and Purchasing modernization initiatives.

The professional development journey extends well beyond initial training and certification achievement. Many successful professionals who began with SAP Ariba training in Pune have built distinguished careers through continuous learning, strategic networking, thoughtful career planning, and commitment to digital excellence. The key to sustained success lies in maintaining curiosity about emerging cloud technologies, building deep expertise in specialized Purchasing areas, and developing strong professional relationships within the digital Purchasing and cloud technology community.

entry.title: Re: I can't to assign a recipient name to a namespace "/M...
entry.content:
Hi @0uTY 

Thank you for your qeustion.

To resolve the issue with assigning recipients using namespace /MMIM in S/4HANA Public Cloud, I suggest you follow the following steps:

First, you need to verify recipients are correctly configured for your communication scenario via the Assign Recipients to Users app.

Then ensure scope items needed for Business Network integration are activated. Missing scenarios can prevent assignment.

Thereafter check that your users have required roles and business catalogs, you can refer to SAP Note 3096609 for authorization details.

Finally, reload or sync your system configurations after changes.

If it is still unresolved, contact SAP Support with cloud version details and reference the relevant SAP documentation.

I hope this provides some insights. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

Assign Recipients to Users

Configure Message Monitoring in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

entry.title: SAP Community Groups Sunset Process
entry.content:
The way the sunset process works, is that we will create a new read-only "Archived Content" area of the Community that we will move the entire group and its content to. This means that all the content of the inactive groups will still remain in the public community, and can be found both by search and by navigation. Sunsetting groups will therefore also not affect any community member's reputation, as all content you have published to any of the sunset groups will remain in your profile. 

The images below are from our test system, to give you an idea of what the Archived Content are of the Community will look like. 
New "Archived Content" area added to the navigation bar: 

 

Archived Groups will follow the same navigation pattern as the Groups area of the Community:  

Content will be marked as read-only:

entry.title: Re: sapgui front end that compatible for EHP4 and EHP 8
entry.content:
Hi @manthana99c17 

Yes, SAPGUI Version 8 is compatible with both SAP ECC 6.0 EHP4 and EHP8. Please note, SAPGUI releases are generally backward compatible with older SAP ERP versions and this includes EHP4 and EHP8, as confirmed by SAP. However, it is always advised to test key business scenarios after upgrading the GUI front end to ensure no custom transactions or add-ons are impacted.

I hope this provides the desired insights. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP SF LMS Assign security domains automatically to u...
entry.content:
Hi Olga,

We are facing the same issue at a client currently. We're going to put a custom field on the Employee Profile, dedicated to LMS domains, and map it to the domain field in System Configuration > Connectors on the sfuser.field.mapping.data.DMN_ID mapping property. 

You could also use an existing field (like country or legal entity) if that matches your domain structure. Just Make sure the field on EP holds the same values as the domains in your LMS, because if the domain ID doe not exist in LMS, the connector will create them automatically themselves. If the field is empty, the users should end up in the configured default domain.

Not tested yet in practice, but we believe this should work.

entry.title: Re: Two PR items triggered from external operation in maintenance order
entry.content:
Hello,

Not sure if you found an answer to this, but i will tell you my solution.

When using a control key with external processing (e.g., YBM2 with External Operation flag active), SAP automatically generates a PR item for the operation itself, even if service lines (item category D) are already defined under the Services tab. So, you end up with:

- One PR item from the external operation itself (which is empty if no value is maintained).

- One PR item from the service line (item category D) — which contains your actual service data.

You need to adjust the control key configuration to avoid PR generation from the operation line:  “Define Control Key” -> Control key: YBM2 -> Deselect the Following Flags: External Processing → Uncheck this; Automatically generate PR (if available) uncheck this.

You can test it and see if it works for you 🙂

Best regards,

Luisa

entry.title: Building an AI-Powered Assistant with SAP AI Core and SAP Build Apps
entry.content:
Disclaimer: The insights shared in this blog are based on my personal observations and learning. They may not apply universally, and I encourage readers to conduct their own research and make an informed decision before using this content for productive use.

In today’s rapidly evolving digital landscape, AI-powered assistants have emerged as indispensable assets for businesses aiming to elevate customer service, increase productivity, and optimize operations. This comprehensive guide will walk you through the process of building a sophisticated AI assistant using SAP AI Core and SAP Build Apps—a powerful, no-code combination that empowers users to harness enterprise-grade AI capabilities without the need for traditional programming expertise.

Architecture Overview

  1. SAP Build Apps: Serves as the front-end development platform for crafting intuitive user interfaces
  2. SAP AI Core: Acts as the robust runtime engine that executes AI workloads and delivers foundation model capabilities
  3. BTP Destination: Functions as the middleware layer that securely connects Build Apps to AI Core, ensuring smooth and scalable integration.

The integration flow works as follows:

Users engage with the application through the intuitive SAP Build Apps interface. When an input is submitted, it is seamlessly transmitted via BTP Destinations to SAP AI Core, which orchestrates the request. AI Core then processes the input using the powerful GPT-4o model hosted on Azure OpenAI. Once the AI generates a response, the result is returned through the same secure channel and elegantly displayed within the Build Apps interface for the user.

Prerequisites

  1. SAP BTP account (free tier)
  2. Access to SAP AI Core with sap-internal or extended service plan
  3. SAP Build Apps subscription
  4. SAP AI Launchpad subscription

Step 1: Setting Up Your SAP BTP Environment

Enable Required Services or Applications

  1. Navigate to your SAP BTP Global Account
  2. Go to Instances and Subscriptions section
  3. Search for and enable these applications:
    • AI Launchpad
    • AI Core
    • Build Apps

Subscribe to SAP Build Apps 

Create AI Core Instance

  1. In your sub-account, go to Services > Instances and Subscriptions
  2. Create a new instance of AI Core
  3. Choose the extended or sap-internal service plan (required for foundation models)
  4. Create a service key for the AI Core instance - save this information as you'll need it later

Step 2: Configure SAP AI Launchpad

Create Connection to AI Core

  1. Open SAP AI Launchpad
  2. Navigate to the Connections section
  3. Create a new connection using the service key information from Step 1
  4. Create a workspace (you can use "default" as the name)

Set Up Foundation Models

  1. In AI Launchpad, go to ML Operations > Scenarios
  2. You should see Foundation Models - these are pre-configured scenarios provided by SAP.

Deploy the Model

  1. Go to Deployments and click Create
  2. Select your configuration
  3. Choose Standard duration (or custom if you prefer)
  4. Wait for the deployment status to show Running - this may take a few minutes

Step 3: Create BTP Destination

The destination acts as a bridge between Build Apps and AI Core.

  1. In BTP Cockpit, go to Connectivity > Destinations
  2. Click New Destination and configure like below in screenshot and add the additional properties as well:

Additional Properties:

HTML5.DynamicDestinationtrue
URL.headers.AI-Resource-Groupdefault
AppGyver.Enabledtrue
URL.headers.Content-Type application/json

Step 4: Build the Chatbot Interface with SAP Build Apps

Create New Project

  1. Open SAP Build Apps
  2. Click Create > Build an Application
  3. Choose Web & Mobile Application
  4. Name your project: Virtual Assistant

Design the User Interface

  1. Remove all the previous elements from the UI
  2. Add a Large Image List Item for displaying chat history
  3. Modify the list item:
  4. Add an Input Field for user messages (remove the label)
  5. Add a Button with label "Submit"

Create Variables

Create these variables to manage data flow:

  1. App Variable:
    • history (List of objects)
      • role (Text)
      • content (Text)

  1. Page Variable: input
    • Type: Text
    • Purpose: Capture user input

Step 5: Set Up Data Integration

Create Data Entity

  1. Go to Integrations tab
  2. Select SAP BTP Destination REST API integration
  3. Configure:
    • Name: ai-assistant-tool
    • Destination: Select your created destination (ai-destination)
    • Resource Schema: Create list of objects with role and content properties

Configure API Endpoint

  1. Enable the Create method (for POST requests)
  2. Set the relative URL: /inference/deployments/[DEPLOYMENT_ID]/chat/completions?api-version=2024-06-01 
    • Get the deployment ID from your AI Launchpad deployment URL

Test the Connection

Create Data Variable

  1. Create a Data Variable using your data entity
  2. This will handle the communication with AI Core

Step 6: Implement Chatbot Logic

Bind UI Components

  1. Bind List Component:
    • Select the Large Image List Item
    • Bind Repeat with to app variable: history
    • Bind Title to data item: role
    • Bind Description to data item: content
  2. Bind Input Field:
    • Bind Value to page variable: input

Add Button Logic

Create the following logic flow for the Send button:

Set App Variable ->  Create Record -> Set App Variable (for response) -> Set Page Variable:

Step 7: Testing Your Chatbot

Web Testing

  1. Use the Preview feature in Build Apps
  2. Test various scenarios

Mobile Testing

  1. Install the SAP Build Apps mobile app
  2. Scan the QR code from your project
  3. Test on both iOS and Android devices

 

Conclusion

You’ve now developed a sophisticated AI-powered assistant using SAP’s low-code/no-code platform — a clear demonstration of how SAP Build Apps intuitive interface design seamlessly integrates with the advanced AI capabilities of SAP AI Core.

The assistant you've created goes beyond a basic Q&A tool. It’s a flexible, scalable solution that can be tailored to a wide range of business scenarios. Whether your goal is to enhance customer service, streamline internal operations, or deliver personalized learning experiences, this solution provides a solid foundation for building intelligent, enterprise-ready applications.

entry.title: Re: Get data from one table to another via linked models
entry.content:
Hi @Joao_Costa 

Regarding your question, yes, it is possible, but the method depends on your requirement.

For your reporting only, you can link the models and display a blended measure in the Investimentos row.

Please note that for planning scenarios, you can use an Advanced Formula script to read values from MDL_Investimentos_JC and write them into the P&L model.

If your Investimentos should be permanently stored in the P&L model, you should set up an import job to pull the data regularly.

Here is what i recommend, use Blending if you only need it in the story for reporting. Use Data Actions or Import Jobs if the data should persist in the P&L for calculations and planning.

I hope this provides the desired insight. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: sapgui front end that compatible for EHP4 and EHP 8

entry.title: Re: Growth Rebate in Condition Contract
entry.content:
Hello Drahul,

The problem for Year over Year value growth can be solved by creating additional CDS view for previous year. You would need to add customizing here:

Settlement Management -> Condition Contract Management -> Condition Contract Settlement -> Define and Configure Profiles for Business Volume Determination.

You should maintain additional tables for previous year - there is an indicator for BV CDS Period where you can choose 'Previous year'. Afterwards, you need to transfer the value via Amount Fields.

To calculate the growth you need to anyway contact your ABAP developer, there are many approaches which can be used but I would go for either development of scale base routine or using point scale and creating logic to calculate growth in transfer manager.

One of the things you should take into consideration that condition for calculation should be an item condition because if you use point scale for the purpose.

entry.title: Re: SAP B1 10.0 - SBO Mailer stop working for Gmail (from...
entry.content:
Hi @AksharChem 

Thank you for your question.

To continue sending emails via Gmail using SBO Mailer, I suggest you consider doing the following:

First, enable 2-Factor Authentication and generate a Gmail app password for the mailer.

Then set up SMTP Relay service in Google Admin Console and configure SBO Mailer to use this relay with IP-based authentication.

Finally, check for future SBO Mailer updates that supports OAuth 2.0 or consider evaluating third-party mailers with OAuth support.

I hope this provides the desired insights. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: How to Identify POs at 1st Tag Release (Status 03) in...
entry.content:
Hi @PTiwari 

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through it.

Standard PO status 03 only indicates not released, which includes POs in the first release step as well as fully held or unreleased POs.

Please note that there is no direct standard field or CDS view that distinctly flags POs at the first release stage.

I suggest you consider using the CDS view I_PurchaseOrderAPI01 and integrating workflow or release decision logs to determine your detailed approval statuses.

Make sure to utilize the Flexible Workflow Administrator app to monitor the release workflows and extract release step details.

It is important to note that custom reporting based on workflow tables may be required to meet precise reporting requirements.

See KBA 3556752 for more details.

I hope this provides the desired insights. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

Hi @ryoma-murakami 

Thank you for your question.

The older business catalogue’s replacement is the Manage Mass Maintenance Business Partners app with the ID: F7974A. It is part of scope item 7MI in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.

For future catalog or app replacements:

I suggest you check the SAP Fiori Apps Library

Review scope items activated in your system or consult the SAP Help Portal for latest app documentation

Please note that this new app offers enhanced mass maintenance functionalities for business partner master data.

I hope this provides the desired insights. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Replacement for the deprecated catalog “SAP_CMD_BC_BP...
entry.content:
Hello @ryoma-murakami 

Thank you for your query regarding the deprecated business catalogue SAP_CMD_BC_BP_MASSMAINT_PC Mass Maintenance - Business Partner Master in SAP S/4HANA public cloud edition.

SAP regularly updates and deprecates business catalogues. When a catalogue is deprecated, SAP provides guidance and successor catalogues directly in the system. To find the replacement for this catalogue, please use the Fiori app Manage Business Role

Changes After Upgrade. This app lists all deprecated business catalogues and shows their recommended replacements, ensuring your authorisation setup is always current. You can also download a CSV report or check the catalogue details for specific successor information.

For further information on this process, refer to the Official SAP Help documentation:

Alternatively, the SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library lets you search for business partner maintenance or mass maintenance functionalities and their associated business catalogues:

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Filtering in Advanced Event Mesh from IDOC
entry.content:
Hi @priya_sshekhar 

Thank you for your question.

AEM topic subscriptions filter based on topic names and wildcards but do not support filtering on payload attributes such as customer account groups directly. To enable you filter IDocs by account groups 0002 and 0003, you can implement filtering either:

In SAP CPI before publishing to AEM, or in the consumer application processing AEM messages.

Alternatively, publishing separate topics per customer account group at source can help you carry out topic-level filtering.

Please refer to SAP documentation for best practices.

Publish and Subscribe to Events

Topic Architecture Best Practices

 

I hope this provides the desired insights. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAPUI5 attachPropertyChange not working when extendin...
entry.content:
For me this also is confusing but you can easily make it work by using PropertyBinding.

...
const publicSearchModel = searchControl.getPublicSearchModel();
const selectionVisibilityBinding = new sap.ui.model.PropertyBinding(
publicSearchModel,
"/selectionVisibility",
publicSearchModel.getContext("/")
);
selectionVisibilityBinding.attachChange((oEvent) => {
...

Also see official documentation of model event 'propertyChange'.
https://sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/#/api/sap.ui.model.Model%23events/propertyChange
...
The propertyChange event is fired when changes occur to a property value in the model. The event contains a reason parameter which describes the cause of the property value change. Currently the event is only fired with reason sap.ui.model.ChangeReason.Binding which is fired when two way changes occur to a value of a property binding.
...

entry.title: Re: Serial Number in Storage Bin Location
entry.content:
Hello @Charisma_fitra 

Although you’re using the same Serial Number (SN) Profile for both products, the behaviour might vary depending on the existing stock levels and how SNs are managed in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

The error occurs because your old product already has stock without serial numbers, while the SN profile now requires every goods receipt to include them. SN management cannot be applied retroactively; existing stock remains non-SN, and any new GR must comply with the profile rules.

To resolve this, you need to either proceed with the options available.

Clear or transfer out the old non-SN stock and re-receipt it with serial numbers, or separate legacy stock from new SN-managed stock.

Let me know if you need more support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: 🔐 Strengthening SAP BTP Security: SSO with Cloud Connector Using Token-Based Auth (Replacing SUSER)
entry.content:
About Me

Hare Krishna 🙏 I am an SAP BTP Cloud Architect sharing practical insights, solutions, and real-world experiences from the SAP ecosystem.

🌍Introduction

Security is at the heart of SAP BTP (Business Technology Platform) administration. Traditionally, basic authentication with SUSER credentials was required when connecting SAP Cloud Connector (SCC) with a BTP subaccount. While functional, this approach has critical drawbacks:

⚠️Static credentials stored in config
⚠️Weak auditability
⚠️Complex user/password management

With the adoption of token-based authentication and Single Sign-On (SSO) using a Custom Identity Provider (IdP), SAP now offers a smarter and more secure way of handling access. This blog explains how the shift strengthens security, simplifies user management, and eliminates the dependency on SUSER credentials.

🚀What’s New: Token-Based Authentication for the SCC ↔ Subaccount Link

Instead of sending an S-user + password when adding/maintaining the subaccount in SCC, you trigger an SSO flow: the subaccount’s trust configuration redirects to your Custom IdP, issues a short-lived token, and BTP validates it to complete the SCC connection.

Why it matters

  • ❌No static S-user secrets in SCC

  • ✅Short-lived tokens + centralized IdP policies/MFA

  • ✅Clean audit trail and easy revocation

⚙️Step-by-Step Configuration (Corrected)

Step 1 — Configure Custom IdP in the BTP Subaccount

  • BTP Cockpit → Subaccount → Security → Trust Configuration

  • Add/enable your Custom IdP (SAP IAS / Azure AD / Okta, etc.) for user logon

  • Ensure metadata/trust is correct (SAML/OIDC per your org standard)

Step 2 — Provision the Admin & Map Roles (in Subaccount)

  • Ensure the admin user exists in the subaccount and is mapped to the Custom IdP

  • Assign the Cloud Connector Administrator role collection (name may vary by tenant)

  • ⚠️Without this mapping, the token flow will fail when SCC tries to connect

Step 3 — Connect SCC to the Subaccount via Token-Based SSO

  • In SCC Admin UI → Subaccounts → Add / Maintain Subaccount

  • Choose token-based/SSO (not username/password)

  • The flow opens the BTP subaccount trust → redirects to your Custom IdP

  • Authenticate as the mapped admin; on success, BTP validates the token and SCC shows the subaccount as connected

Step 4 — Validate the Connection

  • Confirm SCC shows Connected (region, Subaccount ID, location ID as applicable)

  • Optionally verify in BTP cockpit (Connectivity / Cloud Connector view) that the subaccount link is healthy

Step 5 — Existing Subaccounts (Legacy) – Do It at Certificate Renewal

🔄For old subaccounts already connected with S-user: switch to token-based SSO during the certificate renewal window.

  • Keep the same subaccount; update trust to Custom IdP (if not already)

  • Re-establish the SCC ↔ subaccount link using token-based SSO (no S-user)

  • This upgrades security without spinning up a new subaccount

🛡️ Key Benefits

  • No S-user secrets stored in SCC

  • MFA & policies enforced centrally at your IdP

  • Auditable (IdP + BTP logs)

  • Lower ops overhead (no password rotations, fewer incidents)

🏗️ Architecture Flow — SCC ↔ Subaccount Token-Based SSO

[Cloud Connector]
│ (1. Connect/renew request to subaccount)
▼
[SAP BTP Subaccount – Trust Configuration]
│ (2. Redirects to Custom IdP for auth)
▼
[Custom Identity Provider (IdP)]
│ (3. User/admin authenticates → token issued)
▼
[SAP BTP Subaccount]
│ (4. Validates token & completes trust)
▼
[Secure Connection Established: SCC ↔ Subaccount]

Step notes

  1. SCC initiates the subaccount connection (add/renew).

  2. Subaccount trust hands off to your IdP.

  3. IdP authenticates the mapped admin and issues a token.

  4. BTP validates token; the SCC ↔ subaccount link is finalized—no S-user.

 

📸Real-Life Example (With Screenshots)

Here’s how this setup looks in actual environment( BTP trial account is used for performing this setup)

Create user in SAP BTP Subaccount, Provide Cloud Connector administrator privileges.

We will. be using IAS as custom identity provider. Create User in IAS as shown below:

Login to Cloud connector, Provide required details and update $SAP-CP-SSO-PASSCODE$ in Login E-mail section

Make sure Subaccount is connected to IAS using OIDC or SAML Protocols In trust configuration.

Now Create URL like shown below: The URL pattern is https://<subdomain>.authentication.<btp-XSUAA-host>/passcode.

When you access the URl, It will redirect to IAS for authentication

Post successful User authentication, Temporary authentication code is generated. Use it in Cloud connector

Update the token in cloud connector configurations shown below:

Cloud connector is successfully connected to Subaccount.

Now for Legacy systems, where users are already using SUSERID and password, while cert renewal, we can use the SSO mechanism to generate token and renew the certificate.

click on enter user and password

Enter Username , and generate the token using URL pattern is https://<subdomain>.authentication.<btp-XSUAA-host>/passcode.

Token is successfully generated

Certificate is renewed successfully

Cloud connector is successfully connected in Subaccount:

📌Lessons Learned

  • The security move is about the SCC ↔ subaccount link, not just SCC UI logon

  • Provisioning & role mapping in the subaccount is critical for the token flow

  • Use the certificate renewal window to modernize legacy S-user connections with minimal disruption

❓FAQs

Q1. Do we still need S-user anywhere for this connection?
👉No. After token-based SSO is configured, the SCC ↔ subaccount link does not use S-user.

Q2. Which IdPs are supported?
👉SAP IAS, Azure AD, Okta, Ping, etc., via SAML/OIDC per enterprise policy.

Q3. Extra cost?
👉No new SAP license; enterprise IdP subscriptions/policies apply as usual.

Q4. Is this mandatory for all subaccounts now?
👉Not mandated, but it’s the recommended security posture going forward.

Q5. Must the admin user exist in the subaccount?
👉✅Yes. The user must be provisioned in the subaccount, mapped to the Custom IdP, and assigned Cloud Connector Administrator. Otherwise, the SSO/token step fails.

Q6. How do old subaccounts switch from S-user to token-based SSO?
👉✅Use the certificate renewal process to re-establish the link with token-based SSO—no new subaccount needed.

🎯Key Takeaway

Modernize the SCC ↔ subaccount connection with token-based SSO. You’ll remove S-user secrets, enforce corporate IdP controls (MFA, policies), gain clean auditability, and cut down operational toil. For legacy links, plan the switch at the next certificate renewal.

entry.title: About the HANA server to which the DPA connects
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support,

Is it possible to have multiple HANA servers connected to the Data Provisioning Agent?

Thank you!


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: About the HANA server to which the DPA connects
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

It depends on what is meant by "connected to the Data Provisioning Agent". In the SDI landscape, there are Data Sources (or "sources" for short, where the data is taken from) and there is a target HANA system ("target" for short).

Regarding the target system, please see the "Deployment Options" section of our Help Page:

Deployment Options

"You can't have one Data Provisioning Agent registered in multiple SAP HANA instances."

This means you can only specify one target HANA system in the Data Provisioning Agent. However, you can connect to multiple HANA systems as Data Sources:

Architecture and Connections

Best regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Profit Center in Settlement Document | Settlement Management
entry.content:
Is it possible to redetermine Profit Center while creating Settlement document (WB2R_SC/WB2R_SV or manual creation) through a Custom Logic bypassing the SAP standard logic.
Field : Settlement Doc- Line Item - Account Assignment - Profit Center

We tried using the below options
Option 1. Using transfer manager
Option2. Copy Billing Document Profit Center to Settlement document.

Issues faced in the above options:

Option 1- Tried using Transfer Events 23, 25, 39 which has KOMLFP - PRCTR in target structure passing fixed value which doesn't work. Transfer Event - 65 only works for manual creation without material in line item, not via WB2R_SC.
Are there any other events that can be used for WB2R_SC/SV to re-determine the Profit Center.
Can we put a custom logic in here to determine the profit center?

Option 2-
Can I copy Billing Profit Center to Settlement docs, for each line items ?
Currently we notice, although it's coming from Billing document, but it only considers settlement Line Item 1 - Billing Document and passes the same for all line items in settlement doc.

For ex. if Settlement doc no. XXXX has Line item 1, 2 which was created for multiple billing documents, having different Profit Centers - Line item 1's PRCTR is copied to all.
Line item 2 created for billing doc having a different PRCTR is not considered.

In the existing system the profit center in the sales billing document is being determined from a custom logic.

entry.title: Discover how to get in touch with the SAP Store Team!
entry.content:
Discover how to get in touch with the SAP Store Team! 

 

 

First let’s understand that – What is SAP Store and the types of solutions available on SAP Store? 

 

SAP Store is the online marketplace where customers around the world can discover, try, buy, and renew more than 3,000 enterprise solutions from SAP and our trusted partners. Available in more than 200 countries and territories globally, it provides customers with real-time access to innovative solutions to become intelligent enterprises and digitally transform business.  
 

 
 
Solutions from SAP’s partners allow customers to extend their existing SAP technology and solutions with a mix of free trials and paid apps and services. You can search for SAP and partner solutions by categories, including SAP product, industry, publisher, certification type, and more. Partners can grow their businesses using SAP Store to market and deliver their apps, add-ins, and integration kits to SAP’s global customers.  
 
 

Now let’s see the types of solutions which are available on SAP Store! 

 

  • Business Essentials: Essential solutions for your business, published by SAP or SAP partners 
  • Extensions and Add-ons: Products, microservices, content and add-on solutions that require functional prerequisites 
  • API and Technical Components: Solutions that connect and enable data transmission between systems, such as application programming interfaces, technical components, and web services 
  • Technology Components: Offerings with a hardware component published by SAP or SAP partners 
  • Services: Delivered via SAP Global Services and Support, Service Partner, Business Services 
  • Training: Offerings related to SAP Education solutions and education offerings from other providers 

 

And you would come across a question, whether you need to be an SAP Customer to buy SAP partner products on SAP Store. 

 

So, let me tell you that it is not required for one to be the SAP Customer to purchase the solutions published by SAP store, but existing customers will benefit the most because, most of the partner solutions offered on SAP Store build on or extend SAP Solutions. 

 

 

Also you would have a question/concern as how your information provided is stored or transmitted in SAP Store? 

 

Let me tell you that SAP strictly follows the General Data Protection Regulation rules and doesn’t sell or share customer with anyone. And we work diligently to protect the security of customer information during transmission by using Secure Sockets Layer software, which encrypts the information provided. 

 

Also, only the last four digits of your credit card number is stored along with the expiration date of the card in the account. And the payment made on SAP Store by using credit card is always handled by SAP Partner Delego Software. You may go through the link for more details - https://store.sap.com/dcp/en/privacy  

 

 SAP Support cannot assist with any SAP Store questions. You must contact the SAP Store team directly. 

 
 
And to get in touch with SAP Store Team, please click on the following link: https://www.sap.com/store.html. On the right-hand side of the page, you'll see a globe icon—click on it and make sure your country is selected from the list. 

 

 

 And here is the screenshot of the page for reference to find the right path: 

 

 

 
 
 And you may also refer the link here https://store.sap.com/dcp/en/supportform to create Support Request. 
 
You can go through the link to learn about frequently asked questions - https://www.sap.com/store/faq.html#about 

 

 

One last information which I would like to highlight is how you can cancel a subscription bought in SAP Store and the steps are given below: 

 

  1. Log in to https://www.sapstore.com/. 
    2. In the top right-hand corner of the page, click on your name and click on My Account. 
    3. Click on the Subscriptions link on the left-hand side of the page. 
    4. Click on the Cancel Subscription link at the bottom of the page. 

 

 Please Note: SAP Support Engineers cannot do these steps. 

 

Thanks for reading!     
 
 We would love to hear from you, let us know what you think?  
 

If you have any questions, please feel free to ask us in the Q&A All Questions in Customer Experience | SAP Community and All Questions in Support Services | SAP Community     

 

Read more #Customer Interaction Centre blogposts Here!

entry.title: Vertex Tax Integration – Restrict Usage to Sales Transactions Only
entry.content:
We are currently observing that tax amounts are returning as zero for customer invoices, even though Vertex is integrated and should be calculating tax correctly on the sales side.

Interestingly, tax amounts and percentages are being returned correctly for vendor invoices, but our business requirement is to use Vertex exclusively for sales-side (customer) transactions, not for purchasing.

We would like to:

  1. Restrict Vertex tax calculation calls to only sales transactions (e.g., customer invoices, sales orders).

  2. Prevent Vertex from being invoked for purchasing transactions (e.g., vendor invoices, purchase orders).

  3. Resolve the issue where customer invoices are returning zero tax, despite Vertex being expected to handle tax calculation.

Please advise on the necessary configuration or user exit/BADI enhancements required to achieve this behavior within SAP.

entry.title: IDOC_INPUT_ORDERS Date type : Dates are not converted into the date type defined in customazing

FM :IDOC_INPUT_ORDERS  & Date type :

Dates from segment E1EDK03 idoc type ORDERS  are not converted into the date type defined in SPRO  "Define item proposal types" (V_TVAK-KPRGBZ).

 

Then error occurs during treatment cause the date format are in days and not in the default date type defined in customazing.

entry.title: Re: Profit Center in Settlement Document | Settlement Man...
entry.content:
You've already tested:

  • Transfer Events 23, 25, 39 → These typically work for header-level or basic item-level data, but don’t support PRCTR override in WB2R_SC context.
  • Transfer Event 65 → Works only for manual creation without material, not for automated settlement via WB2R_SC.

This confirms that standard transfer manager logic is insufficient for your use case.

SAP provides BAdIs specifically designed to inject custom logic into settlement document creation. These are your best bet for redetermining PRCTR dynamically. These BAdIs are documented in SAP Help portal

entry.title: A blocked invoice is not listed in app Release Blocked Invoice (MRBR)
entry.content:
Dear Experts, 

Currently, we are facing to an issue not found a blocked invoice document in release automatically mode (tcode MRBR) in App: Release blocked invoices (SAP Public Cloud)

Steps to reproducing:

Step 1: Create a Purchase Order (PO) via app Create Purchase Order - Advanced
Step 2: Post Invoice document with quantity and amount accordingly quantity and amount in PO via app Create Supplier Invoice - Advanced 
Step 3: Check Invoice status via app Invoice supplier list

The invoice displayed Blocked (Logistics): Yes
Step 4: Release blocked invoice via app Release blocked invoices
If I enter Invoice document number + Fiscal year and choose Release automatically, there is no invoice documents displayed here with message "Blocking reason deleted 0 lines"
If I If I enter Invoice document number + Fiscal year and choose Release manually, the invoice document is displayed and can release

My question is below:

1. Why does the invoice document display in manual release mode but not in automatic release mode? 

2. Could you explain under what circumstances an invoice document can be automatically released in SAP, and what conditions trigger this functionality?

Thank you very much for all your help
Gigi

entry.title: Re: IDOC_INPUT_ORDERS Date type : Dates are not converted...
entry.content:
The root cause of the issue is in Segment E1EDK03 carries date information with qualifiers (IDDAT) like:

  • 001 = Document Date
  • 002 = Delivery Date
  • 022 = Purchase Order Date, etc.

The date format in E1EDK03-DATUM is typically in YYYYMMDD format.

In SPRO → Sales and Distribution → Sales → Sales Documents → Define Item Proposal Types, the field KPRGBZ defines the date type:

  • 1 = Day
  • 2 = Week
  • 3 = Month

If your system expects Week (2) but receives a day-based date, it throws the “period W not valid” error.

To overcome from this, what you can do is ensure that the IDDAT value in E1EDK03 matches the expected date type. For example, If KPRGBZ = 2 (Week), then DATUM should be in YYYYWW format (e.g., 202534 for week 34 of 2025).

Consider exits like EXIT_SAPLVEDA_001 or EXIT_SAPLVEDA_002. In EXIT_SAPLVEDA_001, you can intercept the E1EDK03 segment and convert the incoming date to the correct format based on KPRGBZ. You will need to adjust this logic to match your specific IDDAT and KPRGBZ settings.

Finally, in TVAK, ensure that the checkbox “Default PO Date” (BSTVO) is not overriding your IDoc input. The date type (KPRGBZ) is consistent with what your IDoc is sending.

For any reasons, if you are not willing to go with the above custom validation or modifying the user exit is not feasible, consider preprocessing the IDoc using a custom function module or middleware logic to convert the date format before it reaches IDOC_INPUT_ORDERS and adjust the segment E1EDK03-DATUM accordingly

entry.title: Withholding tax items not visible until invoice is paid
entry.content:
Dear community,

I am working with the Run Statutory Reports application, specifically in the area of withholding tax reporting in SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud. Within the section Manage Withholding Tax Items, I can see withholding tax entries, but only for invoices that have already been paid.

In my case, I am working in Spain with the statutory models, particularly Modelo 111. From a legal and compliance perspective, it would be more accurate to display all withholding tax items at the time of invoicing, regardless of whether the invoice has been paid or not.

Interestingly, when I generate the .txt file for the statutory report, it does include the invoices that are posted but not yet paid, and the output file is correct. The issue seems to be only with the Manage Withholding Tax Items application, which displays withholding tax items only after payment

I hope you can help me.

Regards.

entry.title: Re: Vertex Tax Integration – Restrict Usage to Sales Tran...
entry.content:
In EXIT_SAPLFYTX_USER_001, you can add logic to skip Vertex invocation for purchasing transactions by checking the document type or transaction origin.

If Vertex is integrated but returning zero tax, it’s likely due to missing or incorrect data elements being passed to Vertex.

Though you would have checked the below areas, still worth checking again

Pricing Procedure: Ensure condition types examples like YTXE, YTGT, YTXD are correctly configured to trigger Vertex. Access Sequence: Confirm that tax-relevant fields (e.g., jurisdiction, material tax classification) are populated. Customer & Material Master: Validate tax classification indicators are set correctly. Ensure the correct date (e.g., GI date vs. order date) is passed to Vertex. You can control this via EXIT_SAPLFYTX_USER_001.

Also check if custom Requirement Routines like 939 or 949 is used in the pricing procedure to avoid mandatory tax errors or exclusions.

So the summary of actions would be

entry.title: First Experiences GenAI-driven extensibility assistant for Custom Fields and Custom Logic app
entry.content:
These are my first experiences with the extensibility assistant

Use within Custom Fields:


You can call the extensibility assistant in the Custom Fields app start screen, and in the details screen of a single custom field.

Calling the extensibility assistant in the start screen:

Example Prompt :Create a Z field in the Journal Entry Item Level , Field Name : Reference1 and Field Description : Reference 1_HD , Data Type : Char/Text Field Length : 20 and Enable it for the RAP BO I_JOURNALENTRYTP

In the initial screen of the Custom Fields app on the button bar at the top right of the custom field list, you'll find a open assistant button. 

Enter the prompt it will preselect Business context

 After selecting the right context accept the proposal from SAP it will create the field and enable to edit for detail screen 

Calling the extensibility assistant in the details screen:

  • On the button bar at the bottom of the screen, you'll find the diamond button.

  • if you want to ask about a custom field displayed on the details screen, you can refer to it using expressions like “this field”. A common use case is seeking assistance to expose the field through an OData service, UI, CDS view, or SOAP API.

  • Once selected Press save and publish manually . As you see from the below the field is automatically extended in the SOAP API section based on the prompt .

 

Use within Custom Logic:

  • Start the extensibility assistant in the Custom Logic app by clicking the Open Assistant button on the implementations table toolbar

 

  •  The extensibility assistant will show a list of BAdIs that fit your request or a message if no BAdIs were found. 

Select and create implementation . This will only help to find right BADIs not generation of the coding in the BADI 🙂

entry.title: Re: A blocked invoice is not listed in app Release Blocke...
entry.content:
To answer your question, Why does the invoice appear in manual release but not in automatic release?, is the key difference lies in how SAP interprets the blocking reason and whether it qualifies for automatic release.

So if your invoice is blocked due to a logistics reason (e.g., GR/IR mismatch, missing goods receipt), it may not qualify for automatic release unless the system detects that the issue has been resolved and falls within configured tolerances. Having said that, SAP will only release blocked invoices automatically if all blocking reasons are resolved and the invoice meets the following conditions:

  • Price or quantity variance is within tolerance limits (configured in SPRO under Logistics Invoice Verification)
  • Goods receipt has been posted, if GR-based invoice verification is active
  • No manual payment block is set on the invoice
  • Invoice is not flagged for approval or workflow hold

If any of these conditions are not met, the invoice will not appear in automatic mode, even if it can be released manually.

So what you can do is check the blocking reason in the invoice document (via MIR4 or the app) and confirm whether it's system-determined or manually set. Review your tolerance settings in configuration (SPRO → Materials Management → Logistics Invoice Verification → Incoming Invoice → Set Tolerance Limits). Ensure that GR has been posted and matches the invoice quantity. Avoid setting manual blocks unless necessary.
